metadata.title: 95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology - Inteli - Institute of Technology and Leadership
metadata.description: 95% of AI projects fail not because of the technology, but because of the lack of strategy, quality data and real integration in companies.

content_blocks.text: Inteli>Tech Market>95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology
95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology
content_blocks.section: 95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology

Inteli>Tech Market>95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology

- Mauricio Garcia
- 19 Sep 2025
- Mauricio Garcia
- 19 Sep 2025
content_blocks.section: 95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology

content_blocks.text: Many people are commenting on theState of AI in Business 2025fromMIT,which states that 95% of attempts to make money or efficiency with AI models have failed.
content_blocks.section: 95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology

content_blocks.text: I have insisted on this. AI is a powerful tool, but it doesn't work on its own, without human agency. It's not a silver bullet. It's not enough to give everyone ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, etc. and that's it.
content_blocks.section: 95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology

content_blocks.text: Here's what the report says: "...the main reason for the failures lies in the learning gap. This is because companies still don't know how to use the new tools well or how to take advantage of them in their work routine."
content_blocks.section: 95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology

content_blocks.text: There's no way around it, you have to get your hands into the code and develop specific agents for each situation. And "no code" solutions are only delaying this. They give the feeling of speed in development, but it's chicken flight. They're only good for small projects and proofs of concept.
content_blocks.section: 95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology

content_blocks.text: Also, check out this article about "Parallel AI", which is the use of AI assistants without formal authorization from the company. In other words, the company is failing in its AI projects, while its employees are using it "on the side". There is no easy path, no silver bullet and no magic formula. We carry on as always:
content_blocks.section: 95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology

content_blocks.text:
There is no easy path, no silver bullet and no magic formula. We carry on as always:

- Choosing a relevant problem
- Clear definition
- Data quality
- Good people in development
content_blocks.section: 95% of AI projects go wrong, and the reason is not the technology
